tool.name: Cluster.fragments
tool.description: Group sequences that are part of a larger sequence
tool.command:
echo 'cluster.fragments( fasta=$fasta, diffs=$diffs, percent=$percent, #if $count: count=$count, #end if name=$names )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur &&
## move output files to correct destination prefix="$fasta" && mv mothur.*.logfile "$logfile" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.fragclust.fasta "$out_fasta" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.fragclust.names "$out_names"

param.name: diffs
param.label: diffs - Number of mismatched bases to allow between sequences in a group (default 0)

param.name: percent
param.label: percent - percentage of differences allowed ( between 1 and 100, default 0)
param.help: The percent parameter allows you to set percentage of differences allowed, default=0. percent=2 means if the number of difference is less than or equal to two percent of the length of the fragment, then cluster. You may use diffs and percent at the same time to say something like: If the number or differences is greater than 1 or more than 2% of the fragment length, don't merge.

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The cluster.fragments_ command groups sequences that are part of a larger sequence.
.. _cluster.fragments: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Cluster.fragments
v1.21: Updated to Mothur 1.33. Added count parameter.
